# The `LoopBlocksTraversal` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

## Description {#details}

Traverse the blocks in a loop using a depth-first search.

Definition at line 200 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopiterator-h">LoopIterator.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### begin() {#ade12a5fc15abf3f3b3a37d48a079c807}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="POTIterator llvm::LoopBlocksTraversal::begin ()"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Postorder traversal over the graph.

This only needs to be done once. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/po-iterator">po&#95;iterator</a> &quot;automatically&quot; calls back to visitPreorder and finishPostorder to record the DFS result.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopiterator-h/#l00216">216</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopiterator-h">LoopIterator.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### visitPreorder() {#a42ef0781e13ec7d9a9811b8016d1b9b4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::LoopBlocksTraversal::visitPreorder (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; BB)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Called by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/po-iterator">po&#95;iterator</a> upon reaching a block via a CFG edge.

If this block is contained in the loop and has not been visited, then mark it preorder visited and return true.

TODO: If anyone is interested, we could record preorder numbers here.
